About Me

Hi, I’m Brenda :). I am in my final year at SF State, working torwards my bachelors degree in computer science. I’ve worked on several projects in my coursework where I developed a keen interest in Agile development and managing projects to completion.

Currently seeking internships and full-time opportunities in project management for Summer 2024!

Experience

Web Development Intern

10/2022 - 03/2023
Academic Technology @ SFSU

The Academic Technology Office serves campus technological needs and completes projects at the request of several on-campus entities. Web development interns work under the mentorship of software developers, quality assurance testers, and application administrators

  • Assisted in UI/UX evaluations in the office’s on-premise private cloud environment.
  • Participated in professional development including exposure to web dev design concepts.

Advocacy and Recruitment Liaison

08/2022 - 08/2023
Computing Alliance of Hispanic-Serving Institutions @ SFSU

CAHSI advocates program serves to engage student leaders to serve as advocates for the computer science community. Advocates gain a network of other students leaders that are fostering communnities around them. Latino advocacy reminds us of the importance of different cultures and societal gaps. Diversity is a strength that enriches society.

  • Hosted workshops on diversity and inclusion for computer science (CS) students
  • Founded and delivered “Encouraging Diversty in Tech”, a biweekly newsletter to disseminate job opportunities and resources to CS students
  • Partnered with other diversity organizations to develop a professional support network

Orientation Leader

04/2022 - 08/2022
New Student & Family Program @ SFSU

Orientation Leaders (OLs) assist with the implementation of San Francisco State University’s New Student & Family Orientation Program (NSFP). OLs are current students who are well-respected, academically balanced leaders on campus.

  • Assisted in the preparation of over 30 orientation sessions: scheduling, documentation, and staffing/logistics.
  • Mentored newly admitted students through orientation, connecting them with academic resources and student life at SFSU.
  • Hosted campus tours for several hundred students and guided them through course selection and enrollment.

Summer Web Dev Program Participant

04/2022 - 08/2022
Microsoft, Seattle (Remote)

During this 8 week mentorship program, groups of 3 undergraduate students are paired with a full-time Microsoft employee to develop a web application of their choice. We built a simple Django application to be used by any social organization on the SFSU campus. Key features included the ability to create posts as well as user/database management.

Projects

Club Website (Django) - This website was created during my 8 week mentorship program with Microsoft. We created a club website for Hermanas Unidas de SFSU, a social latinx organization. We designed this Django application to allow club officers to create and schedule announcements to the group at large. Officers are granted admin privileges which can be additionally granted or revoked as they see fit. Follow the link above or visit it here:
https://brendabeltran.me/club-website
Job Platform - This application was developed during the fall semester as part of an academic project. It is a full stack application built with React.js, Express.js, and Node.js. It facilitates employment connections between employers and job seekers. The goal was to establish a user-friendly platform that speeds up the hiring process by advancing interactions between job seekers and employers. The application offers two different sign-in methods fit to the user's role, which strengths the overall accessibility and functionality of the platform. Follow the application URL above OR visit our github repo here: https://github.com/CSC-648-SFSU/csc648-01-fall23-team03
